style.name: Scottish-Style Export Ale
style.description: The overriding character of Scottish export ale is sweet, caramel-like, and malty. Its bitterness is perceived as low to medium. Hop flavor or aroma should not be perceived. It has medium body. Fruity-ester character may be apparent. Yeast characters such as diacetyl (butterscotch) and sulfuriness are acceptable at very low levels. The color will range from golden amber to deep brown. Bottled versions of this traditional draft beer may contain higher amounts of carbon dioxide than is typical for mildly carbonated draft versions. Chill haze is acceptable at low temperatures. Though there is little evidence suggesting that traditionally made Scottish-style export ales exhibited peat smoke character, the current marketplace offers many Scottish-style export ales with peat or smoke character present at low to medium levels. Thus a peaty/smoky character may be evident at low to medium levels (ales with medium-high or higher smoke character would be considered a smoke flavored beer and considered in another category). Scottish-style export ales may be split into two subcategories: Traditional (no smoke character) and Peated (low level of peat smoke character).

breweries.name: Keg & Lantern
breweries.description: Brewery Craftbeer House Brewed Beers in 20oz Pints

breweries.name: Rinn Duin Brewing
breweries.description: Formerly Blackthorn, Rinn Duin Brewing is crafting characteristically traditional, yet distincive English, Irish and Scottish Ales in the heart of the Jersey Shore.

breweries.name: Saugatuck Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Saugatuck Brewing Co. is a traditional Irish style pub that features 15 house-made drafts, hard cider and wines. All beer is produced on site in our 13,000 square foot Brew House. The full menu includes light snacks and unique entrees, along with home made desserts.  We offer 6 mainstay styles in bottles along with 3 seasonals and many specialties.

We feature the only brew-on-site facility in West Michigan. With five copper kettles, an array of natural ingredients, and over 100 recipes, we invite you and your friends to be the Brewmaster for a day. Create your own unique ale and return in two weeks to bottle 60 - 22 oz. bottles of fresh beer with a custom label of your choice.

The Singapore Room is our multi-purpose banquet facility. This includes a 4 tap bar, wine service and customizable menus. The Singapore Room can be rented out for a variety of events including birthdays, graduations, weddings, rehearsal dinners, etc.

breweries.name: Six Ten Brewing
breweries.description: Six Ten Brewing is a locally owned and operated brewery opening soon in the Town and Country neighborhood of Tampa. With over 20 years of brewing experience we produce craft beer in a variety of styles which we will proudly serve in our tasting room while guest can enjoy a front row seat to view the brewing process.

data.name: Wee Muckle
data.description:
Wee Muckle is a large, malt-balanced ale with huge toffee flavors and hints of port-like character.
 
Wee Muckle was the winner of the Gold Medal in the Scotch Ale category at the 2011 Great American Beer Festival

breweries.name: Sun King Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Sun King Brewing Company is an Indianapolis-based craft brewery with a focus on continually creating traditional seasonal and unique specialty beers. 

Sun King rolled its first keg of beer out the door in July 2009 and since that time has grown into the second largest brewery in Indiana, producing over 27,000 barrels of beer in 2014 while selling all of it in Indiana. Sun King's beers have been awarded multiple medals at the Great American Beer Festival and World Beer Cup.

Located in a downtown Indianapolis warehouse, Sun King was the first full-scale production brewery in Indianapolis since 1948. Sun King beer can be enjoyed at fine bars/restaurants and liquor stores throughout Indiana or in their Tasting Room, located in the brewery at 135 N. College Avenue.

data.name: Wee Peat
data.description: Doff the cap of this complex Scottish Ale with 5.6% ALC/VOL, and in a wink you’ll be hearing Highland bagpipes as you sip this smoky, peaty, bonnie good brew. Aye. That’s the high road, that is.

available.name: Year Round
available.description: Available year round as a staple beer.

breweries.name: Squatters Craft Beers
breweries.description:
Although much has changed (now three locations and a microbrewery), we remain firmly dedicated to our original goal; provide our customers world-class handcrafted beer and food in a warm, friendly environment.

As Squatters grew we embraced the Triple Bottom Line philosophy of People Planet Profit. We source healthy ingredients and use environmentally friendly products and services from within our local eco-region. We develop long-term relationships with farmers, growers and suppliers so we know exactly what is, and is not, in the products we buy. We choose to support local non-profit organizations. We buy BlueSky wind power and are continuously working to reduce our carbon footprint.

We believe these and other practices contribute to a healthy community and environment, locally and globally, making our city a better place to live, work, and drink world-class Squatters beers.

data.name: William Wallace
data.description: This legend of a Scottish 80/- has a slightly sweet and malty taste with a hint of toffee.
data.foodPairings: This malty Scottish 80/- Export is suited to all manners of great pub food. Enjoy it with steak pie or haggis all year round.

breweries.name: Black Wolf Brewery
breweries.description: We’re proud of our craft, integrity and quality. But we’re not afraid to break the rules to produce something that breaks the mould. Here’s to good, honest, beer. Beer worth howling for...
